Content: 2*p51629a0224* do not write in this area do not write in this area do not write in this areasection aanswer all questions. for questions 110, in section a, select one answer from a to d and put a cross in the box . if you change your mind, put a line through the box  and then  mark your new answer with a cross .1 the unit for power is the watt. which of the following is equivalent to the watt?  a kg m s  b kg m s  c kg m s  d kg m s(total for question 1 = 1 mark)2 the thickness of a steel sheet is reduced by passing it between two rollers.                             movement of steel sheetrollers the thickness reduces because steel is  a ductile.  b hard.  c malleable.  d stiff.(total for question 2 = 1 mark)

3*p51629a0324*turn over     do not write in this area do not write in this area do not write in this area3 measured quantities can be either vectors or scalars. select the row from the table that is not correct.measurementvector or scalara&scalarbvscalarcpvvectord-vector(total for question 3 = 1 mark)4 a projectile is launched at an angle  to the horizontal and takes a time t to reach its maximum height. which of the following equations could be used to determine the initial velocity u of the projectile?  a u = cosgt  b u = cosgt  c u = singt  d u = singt(total for question 4 = 1 mark)5 the flow of a fluid through a pipe is laminar. which of the following statements correctly describes the velocity of the fluid?  a at a particular position the velocity is constant.  b at a particular position the velocity is continually changing.  c the velocity is a maximum at the edges of the pipe.  d the velocity is always the same in adjacent layers.(total for question 5 = 1 mark)
